author: Allan Ripp
title: A Minute Feels Like 60 Billion Nanoseconds
text:
Four minutes doesn’t sound like a long time to wait for a car, right? But what if the app on your wife’s phone had just showed your Uber driver as only three minutes away? Suddenly his arrival is pushed back. Then another minute passes. Still your chariot remains fixed at a distance of four minutes.
Meanwhile, a fleet of taxis goes by, but you are committed. You tap-tap-tap Uber for an updated ETA, yet it’s the same story. That is how four minutes becomes an eternity and puts you on verge of a stroke.
...
